meanings.definition: The act of committing or entrusting something to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her committal of the task to her colleague showed trust.
meanings.sent2: The committal of the project to the team leader was a wise decision.
meanings.sent3: The committal of the secret recipe to the chef led to a delicious meal.
meanings.sent4: His committal of the treasure map to memory ensured its safety.
meanings.sent5: The committal of the fragile package to the courier required careful handling.

meanings.definition: The act of sending someone to a mental institution or prison.
meanings.sent1: The committal of the criminal to prison followed the court's decision.
meanings.sent2: Her committal to the mental institution was necessary for her well-being.
meanings.sent3: The committal of the mischievous cat to the pet hotel amused the family.
meanings.sent4: His committal to the idea of justice was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The committal of the lost dog to the shelter gave hope for a reunion.

meanings.definition: A formal statement of intention to marry.
meanings.sent1: Their committal to each other was evident in their wedding vows.
meanings.sent2: The committal of their love in marriage brought joy to their families.
meanings.sent3: The committal of the proposal to a romantic dinner was a surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her committal to him was symbolized by the engagement ring.
meanings.sent5: The committal of their hearts to one another was celebrated with a kiss.
